repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

body:
At the sprint, we just ran into the selftests failing for @webknjaz, and it was because he happened to be running the testsuite with Python 3.11.8.

You said:

> the fix which was released in Python 3.11

but the fix actually only made it into Python [3.11.9](https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3119/) and [3.12.3](https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-3124/), which are only around 2 months old now.

@jaraco I suppose it'd make sense to still use the workaround on 3.11 and 3.12 versions before those patch releases, no?

Yes, I agree. I did not trace the origin more deeply than to look at minor versions. I think you're right and the workaround should be enabled for the specified patch versions or made dependent on Python 3.13.

issue.title: ðŸš‘ Clarify patch condition for doctest finder hack

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
There was a regression caused by #12431 that excluded the patch on broken CPython patch version ranges 3.11.0â€“3.11.8 and 3.12.0â€“3.12.2.

This change fixes that by adjusting the patching conditional clause to include said versions.

Closes #12430.
